5. Create skill or script that documents/enforces this behavior

tasks.title: Local LLM + OpenClaw Migration: Self-Hosted Infrastructure
tasks.description:
OBJECTIVE: Research and plan migration from GitHub Copilot VPS subscription to self-hosted OpenClaw running local LLMs on home desktop. Establish cost-efficient, high-performance local infrastructure with Anthropic Opus as primary orchestrator.

EXPECTATIONS FROM ANTHONY:
- Research cost-efficient local LLM options (most capable models like Opus equivalent)
- Identify best self-hosted LLM providers (Ollama, vLLM, LocalAI, etc.)
- Determine hardware requirements for desktop (VRAM, CPU, storage)
- Calculate total cost of ownership vs current GitHub Copilot subscription
- Plan data migration strategy from VPS to local desktop
- Design OpenClaw deployment architecture for local hardware
- Identify any limitations or trade-offs vs cloud-based approach
- Provide step-by-step migration plan with rollback strategy
- Ensure Anthropic Opus (or equivalent local model) runs efficiently as main orchestrator

CONSTRAINTS:
- Desktop computer at home (finite hardware resources)
- Must maintain all current OpenClaw functionality
- Local-only deployment (no cloud dependencies except where unavoidable)
- Cost efficiency is primary driver (cheaper than GitHub Copilot subscription)
- Research phase ONLY - no implementation yet

DELIVERABLES:
1. Comprehensive research report on local LLM landscape (2026)
   - Top 3-5 candidates ranked by capability/cost/local support
   - Specific focus on Anthropic Opus alternatives for local deployment
   
2. Hardware requirements analysis
   - VRAM needed for different model sizes
   - CPU/GPU recommendations
   - Storage requirements for models + OpenClaw
   - Network bandwidth considerations
   
3. Cost analysis
   - Total hardware cost amortized over useful life
   - Electricity costs for 24/7 operation
   - Annual cost vs GitHub Copilot (savings projection)
   
4. Architecture design document
   - How OpenClaw interfaces with local LLM
   - Model switching strategy (multiple models on same hardware)
   - API layer design (ollama/vLLM REST endpoints)
   - Cache and optimization strategy
   
5. Data migration plan
   - What data moves from VPS to desktop
   - What stays cloud-based (if anything)
   - Backup and recovery strategy
   - Timeline estimate for cutover
   
6. Deployment guide (draft)
   - Step-by-step setup for local LLM inference
   - OpenClaw configuration for local models
   - Testing and validation procedures
   - Rollback procedures if issues arise

7. Risk assessment
   - Limitations of local vs cloud
   - Uptime/reliability considerations
   - Performance degradation scenarios
   - Mitigation strategies

SUCCESS CRITERIA:
- Anthony has clear understanding of feasibility and costs
- Top local LLM option identified with evidence
- Hardware specs clearly defined for desktop
- Cost savings quantified (vs GitHub Copilot)
- Step-by-step migration path documented
- Ready for Anthony approval to begin implementation
